etymology.description: 不(不) (bù, "not") + 要(要) (yào, "want") = expressing negation or a command to refrain from wanting or doing something.
etymology.interpretation: The word 不要(不要) (bú yào, "don't; don't want") combines 不(不) (bù, "not") with 要(要) (yào, "want") to express a prohibition or a lack of desire for something. It is commonly used in giving commands or expressing that something is not needed or not wanted.

examples.chinese: 不要浪费时间(不要浪費時間)。
examples.pinyin: bú yào làng fèi shí jiān.

examples.chinese: 我不要再说谎(我不要再說謊)，因为诚实才是最重要的(因為誠實才是最重要的)。
examples.pinyin: wǒ bú yào zài shuō huǎng, yīn wèi chéng shí cái shì zuì zhòng yào.
examples.english: I don't want to lie anymore, because honesty is the most important.

examples.chinese: 如果你说不要(如果你說不要)，就说明你已有主见(就說明你已有主見)。
examples.pinyin: rú guǒ nǐ shuō bú yào, jiù shuō míng nǐ yǐ yǒu zhǔ jiàn.
examples.english: If you say 'no', it shows that you already have your own opinions.
